Not all who feel that they have been called to preach should be encouraged to throw themselves and their families at once upon the church for continuous financial support. 
                                                                           31
. . . Young men who desire to exercise their gifts in the work of the ministry, will find a helpful lesson in the example of Paul at Thessalonica, Corinth, Ephesus, and other places. Although an eloquent speaker, and chosen by God to do a special work, he was never above labor, nor did he ever weary of sacrificing for the cause he loved. A. A. 354.
